digest.description: The SHA256 digest of the blob

getBlob.description: Ensures that the file blob used for a FROM or ADAPTER field exists on  the server. This is checking your Ollama server and not Ollama.ai.

getModels.description: List models that are available locally

ChatRequestInput.description: Request to generate a response in a chat

format.description: Format to return the response in (e.g. "json")

messages.description: Messages of the chat - can be used to keep a chat memory

options.description: Advanced model and runner options for generation and chat requests

done.description: Specifies if the response is complete

done_reason.description: Reason the model stopped generating text

model.description: The name of the model to create

path.description: The path to the model file

quantize.description: Specifies the quantization level of the model

stream.description: If false the response will be returned as a single response object,  rather than a stream of objects

model.description: The name of the model to delete
The name of model to generate embeddings from

options.description: Advanced model and runner options for generation and chat requests

prompt.description: The text to generate embeddings for

context.description: The context parameter returned from a previous request to generate,  this can be used to keep a short conversational memory

format.description: The format to return a response in. Currently the only accepted  value is json

images.description: A list of base64-encoded images (for multimodal models such as  llava)

options.description: Advanced model and runner options for generation and chat requests

prompt.description: The prompt to generate a response for

raw.description: If true no formatting will be applied to the prompt. You may choose  to use the raw parameter if you are specifying a full templated  prompt in your request to the API

stream.description: If false the response will be returned as a single response object,  rather than a stream of objects

system.description: System message to (overrides what is defined in the Modelfile)

template.description: The prompt template to use (overrides what is defined in the  Modelfile)

context.description: When done, encoding of the conversation used in this response

done.description: Specifies if the response is complete

eval_count.description: When done, number of tokens in the response

eval_duration.description: When done, time in nanoseconds spent generating the response

load_duration.description: When done, time spent in nanoseconds loading the model

model.description: The model name that generated the response

prompt_eval_count.description: When done, number of tokens in the prompt

prompt_eval_duration.description: When done, time spent in nanoseconds evaluating the prompt

response.description: The textual response itself. When done, empty if the response was  streamed, if not streamed, this will contain the full response

total_duration.description: When done, time spent generating the response

OptionsInput.description: Advanced model and runner options for generation and chat requests

f16_kv.description: Indicates whether to use 16-bit floating point precision for  key-value pairs, reducing memory usage.  (Default: false)

frequency_penalty.description: Penalizes tokens based on their frequency in the generated text so  far. A higher value reduces the likelihood of frequent tokens being  generated again, promoting more diverse outputs.  (Default: 0.8)

logits_all.description: Specifies whether to output logits for all tokens.  (Default: false)

low_vram.description: Indicates whether to optimize the model for low VRAM usage.  (Default: false)

main_gpu.description: Specifies the primary GPU to use for processing.  (Default: 0)

mirostat.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity.  (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0)

mirostat_eta.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the  generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower  adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm  more responsive.  (Default: 0.1)

mirostat_tau.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text.  (Default: 5.0)

num_batch.description: Specifies the number of batches for processing.  (Default: 512)

num_ctx.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token.  (Default: 2048)

num_gpu.description: Specifies the number of GPUs to use. A value of -1 uses all  available GPUs.  (Default: -1)

num_keep.description: Specifies the number of tokens from the beginning of  the context ot retain when the context limit is reached.  (Default: 4)

num_predict.description: Maximum number of tokens to predict when generating text.  (Default: 128, -1 = infinite generation, -2 = fill context)

num_thread.description: Specifies the number of threads to use for processing. A value of  0 uses all available threads.  (Default: 0)

numa.description: Indicates whether to use Non-Uniform Memory Access (NUMA) for  optimizing memory usage and performance on multi-processor systems.  (Default: false)

penalize_newline.description: Determines whether the model should penalize the generation of  newlines, which can help control the structure and formatting of  the output.  (Default: true)

presence_penalty.description: Applies a penalty to tokens that have already appeared in the  generated text, encouraging the model to introduce new tokens. A  higher value increases this penalty, promoting more varied and less  repetitive output.  (Default: 0.8)

repeat_last_n.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition.  (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)

repeat_penalty.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value  (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower  value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient.  (Default: 1.1)

seed.description: Sets the random number seed to use for generation. Setting this to  a specific number will make the model generate the same text for  the same prompt.  (Default: 0)

stop.description: Sets the stop sequences to use. When this pattern is encountered  the LLM will stop generating text and return. Multiple stop patterns  may be set by specifying multiple separate stop parameters in a  modelfile.

temperature.description: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make  the model answer more creatively.  (Default: 0.8)

tfs_z.description: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable  tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the  impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting.  (default: 1)

top_k.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value  (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value  (e.g. 10) will be more conservative.  (Default: 40)

top_p.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to  more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate  more focused and conservative text.  (Default: 0.9)

typical_p.description: Controls the selection of typical words based on their probability  distribution. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) focuses on more typical  words, reducing the chance of unusual words being selected.  (Default: 1.0)

use_mlock.description: Determines whether to use memory locking to prevent swapping the  model out of RAM.  (Default: false)

use_mmap.description: Determines whether to use memory-mapped files for loading the model,  improving performance on large models.  (Default: true)

vocab_only.description: Indicates whether to only load the vocabulary without the full model.  (Default: false)

ProcessResponse.description: Response with a list of running models

ProgressResponse.description: The response returned from various streaming endpoints

completed.description: The completed size of the task

digest.description: The SHA256 digest of the blob

total.description: The total size of the task

insecure.description: allow insecure connections to the library. Only use this if you are  pulling from your own library during development.

model.description: The name of the model to pull

stream.description: If false the response will be returned as a single response object,  rather than a stream of objects

insecure.description: Whether to allow insecure connections to the library. Only use this  if you are pushing to your library during development

model.description: The name of the model to push in the form of /:

stream.description: If false the response will be returned as a single response object,  rather than a stream of objects

model.description: The name of the model to show

copyModel.description: Copy a model. Creates a model with another name from an existing model.

digest.description: The SHA256 digest of the blob

createBlob.description: Create a blob from a file on the server

createModel.description: Create a model from a Modelfile. It is recommended to set modelfile to  the content of the Modelfile rather than just set path. This is a  requirement for remote create. Remote model creation must also create  any file blobs, fields such as FROM and ADAPTER, explicitly with the  server using Create a Blob and the value to the path indicated in the  response.

deleteModel.description: Delete a model and its data

body.description: Request to generate a response in a chat

generateChat.description: Generate the next message in a chat with a provided model. This is a  streaming endpoint, so there will be a series of responses. Streaming  can be disabled using "stream": false. The final response object will  include statistics and additional data from the request.

generateResponse.description: Generate a response for a given prompt with a provided model. This is  a streaming endpoint, so there will be a series of responses. The final  response object will include statistics and additional data from the  request.

pullModel.description: Download a model from the ollama library. Cancelled pulls are resumed  from where they left off, and multiple calls will share the same  download progress.

pushModel.description: Upload a model to a model library. Requires registering for ollama.ai  and adding a public key first.'

showModel.description: Show information about a model including details, modelfile, template,  parameters, license, and system prompt.
